SENIOR TECHNICAL DESIGNER

SUMMARY

Product Developer/Technical Designer with strengths in apparel, handbags and jewelry.
I have an extensive knowledge of materials, manufacturing and quality assurance.
Dynamic product engineer highly skilled in creative problem solving with exceptional collaborative and interpersonal skills, who illustrates sophisticated expertise in a variety of innovative approaches, to design, prototype and test creative products, services and experiences.
I thrive working within a team environment and I have extensive experience working in partnership with domestic and international teams.

SKILLS

Adobe CS6 Adobe Illustrator Flex PLM Grovesite WebPDM Microsoft Word Excel Optitex Garment specs and sketches Fit Assessment Product Development Technical Direction, Line and Product Review Flat Pattern Making and Corrections Garment Construction Draping

Council.
Participant in BullseyeCrowd: an innovation execution platform to develop a place where anyone at Target can share their ideas and get access to the resources to turn their ideas into reality.to provide new market potential for Target.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Payload Antenna / Electronics Engineer

Location: Chantilly, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Title

Payload Antenna / Electronics Engineer

TS/SCI with CI Poly

Summary: Member will be an integral participant in spacecraft payload Antenna and Electronics requirements development, design analysis, test, and verification. Key areas of focus include antenna design trades, performance predictions and/or evaluations, system impact evaluations, hardware assembly & test, and antenna subsystem integration. Experienced in assessing the feasibility of new antennas & feed electronics designs, antenna & feed electronics manufacturing, and knowledgeable of launch & flight operations of space vehicles. Reviews and coordinates on changes to specifications, ICDs, and system level requirements documentation for spacecraft. Tracks development issues and attends unit, subsystem, system level design reviews. Supports launch and spacecraft on-orbit test as required. Identifies and assesses emerging risks and develop & evaluate proposed burn-down plans. Reviews developer’s readiness to proceed into spacecraft test at various levels of assembly.

Job Duties Include

Provides expert advice and coordination concerning antenna and associated electronics developmentAssess feasibility of new antennas and antenna functionality elementsReview antenna manufacturing specifications for accuracy and ensure documentation is complete and accurateDevelop antenna models for performance evaluations and predictionsReviews and coordinates changes to specifications, ICDs, and system level requirements documentation for spacecraftTracks development issues and attends unit, subsystem, system level design reviewsIdentifies and assesses emerging risks and develops & evaluates proposed burn-down plansReviews developer’s readiness to proceed into spacecraft test at various levels of assemblyExcellent interpersonal, leadership, team building and problem-solving skills with demonstrated ability to be effective in a government/contractor teamExperience in DoD IC acquisition and program management processesExcellent oral and written communication skills

Position Qualifications

9+ years of experienceBachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering requiredExperience with payload digital hardware development and testStrong attention to detailExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to work collaboratively with personnel from multiple functions and at all levels of the customer organization to deliver results; strong networking, interpersonal, customer service skills, team building and problem-solving skills with an ability to be effective in a government/contractor team environmentExcellent Organizational skills, ability to plan, track and maintain due dates for multiple taskers and products central to customer acquisition processes

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

R2087095

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
